Enabling the auto-wipe feature after multiple failed access attempts adds a crucial layer of security to the device. In the event of loss or theft, if unauthorized individuals attempt to access the device and fail multiple times to enter the correct authentication credentials, the device will automatically wipe all data, including the confidential information stored on it. This measure significantly reduces the risk of sensitive data falling into the wrong hands and being leaked or misused. It helps protect the organization's data integrity and confidentiality by ensuring that sensitive data is not compromised even if the device is lost or stolen.

choices.D: Key employees have not taken vacation for 2 years.
choices.C: The company is being sued for false accusations.
choices.A: The financial report may contain undetected material errors.

choices.B: Segregation of duties conflicts are periodically reviewed.
choices.A: Users are required to periodically rotate responsibilities.
choices.C: Data changes are logged in an outside application.
choices.D: Data changes are independently reviewed by another group.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Option D directly addresses the detection of unauthorized data changes by having a separate group or individual review the changes independently. This independent review can help identify discrepancies or anomalies that may indicate unauthorized access or alterations to data, providing an effective control for detecting unauthorized changes. 
Option C poses a Self-review threat since it is responsibility that is shared, not simply access.

Selected Answer: D
One might be tempted to choose C. But C. is not a control, i.e. logging per se is not yet a control. It only becomes part of a control with the review, but the actual control here is the review. So the correct answer is D. Data changes are independently reviewed by another group.
